channel.title: Link I2C input to an object's parameter
channel.description:
Hi all, I really need help with this as I barely know anything about programming and I need to solve this for my final degree project (It's about the Axoloti Board). I was asked to add an I2C knob to control a parameter of an Axoloti object. Now I have an ATTiny connected to a knob, which output is an I2C value that goes from 0 to 255. What I need now is to use that output as an input in my board, and use that data to control any parameter of any object inside the patch, but I think I need to create a custom object for that and I don't know how to do it.
PLEASE HELP!!!!!!!!!!

item.title: Link I2C input to an object's parameter
item.dc:creator: @tele_player
item.description:
@tele_player wrote:

The original post is a bit short on details, so I'll make some assumptions.
First I'll assume he's using a normal pot, connected to analog input on ATTiny, to create an 'I2C pot'.
Next, I'll assume the ATTiny is programmed to perform as an I2C slave, which will return the value of the pot when read by the master.

If those assumptions are valid, the Axoloti object for reading mpr121 capacitive touch sensor should provide insight into how to access an I2C slave.
